Package src.utils

Class InputValidator

java.lang.Object
src.utils.InputValidator
public class InputValidator extends Object
Utility class for validating various input formats used in the hospital system.

  • Method Details

    • isValidHospitalID

      public static boolean isValidHospitalID(String hospitalID)
      Validates if the given hospital ID matches the required format. Valid format is 'P' followed by 4 digits.
      Parameters:
      hospitalID - The hospital ID to validate
      Returns:
      true if the hospital ID is valid, false otherwise

    • isValidEmail

      public static boolean isValidEmail(String email)
      Validates if the given email address matches the standard email format.
      Parameters:
      email - The email address to validate
      Returns:
      true if the email is valid, false otherwise

    • isValidPhoneNumber

      public static boolean isValidPhoneNumber(String phone)
      Validates if the given phone number matches the Singapore phone number format. Valid format is 8 or 9 followed by 7 digits.
      Parameters:
      phone - The phone number to validate
      Returns:
      true if the phone number is valid, false otherwise

    • isValidPatientID

      public static boolean isValidPatientID(String patientID)
      Validates if the given patient ID is valid. Uses the same format as hospital ID.
      Parameters:
      patientID - The patient ID to validate
      Returns:
      true if the patient ID is valid, false otherwise

    • isValidDateFormat

      public static boolean isValidDateFormat(String date)
      Validates if the given date string matches the DD/MM/YYYY format.
      Parameters:
      date - The date string to validate
      Returns:
      true if the date format is valid, false otherwise

    • isValidBloodType

      public static boolean isValidBloodType(String bloodType)
      Validates if the given blood type is one of the standard blood types. Valid blood types are: A+, A-, B+, B-, O+, O-, AB+, AB-
      Parameters:
      bloodType - The blood type to validate
      Returns:
      true if the blood type is valid, false otherwise
